page.title: 01THE SAMPFORDS.
page.content: This rectangle lies to the west of the centre of the village of Gt.Sampford.It is a very rural area consisting mainly of farmland.There are several farmhouses in the area and many of these are moated.There is very little evidence of roads in this district. There is a country lane which joins the farms, to the west of the rectangle which leads to the neighbouring village of Radwinter.The main road from Gt.Sampford to Radwinter lies to the north-east of the rectangle.In the south_west are several small greens.These are just east of the village of Wimbish.There is evidence of a disused airfield towards the south of the rectangle.This land is now used for farming.The River Pant runs through this part of The Sampfords.
